TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed ProviderOptions extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Contains values that specify the type of UI Automation provider.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ProviderOptions ClientSideProvider = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The UI Automation provider is a client-side provider.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ProviderOptions NonClientAreaProvider = int32(4)

Docs.summary: The UI Automation provider is a non-client-area provider.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ProviderOptions OverrideProvider = int32(8)

Docs.summary: The UI Automation provider overrides another provider.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ProviderOptions ProviderOwnsSetFocus = int32(16)

Docs.summary: The UI Automation provider handles its own focus, and does not want [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] to set focus to the nearest window on its behalf when is called. This option is typically used by providers for windows that appear to take focus without actually receiving [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_win32](~/includes/tla2sharptla-win32-md.md)] focus, such as menus and drop-down menus.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ProviderOptions ServerSideProvider = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The UI Automation provider is a server-side provider.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ProviderOptions UseComThreading = int32(32)

Docs.summary: The UI Automation provider expects to be called according to COM threading rules. If the provider is in a Single-Threaded Apartment, it will be called only on the apartment thread. Only Server-side providers can use this option.
